channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mike Johnson Shuts Door on Key Health Care Vote, and a Dangerous New Drug Hits U.S. Cities
item.description: Plus, the subway stop that’s also a museum.

item.title: Factory 2030 runs on more than code. As a CEO, I see the power of agentic AI—and the trust gap that we must close
item.description: Autonomous systems often make headlines. But on the factory floor, the real goal is reliability. And that means keeping humans involved.

item.title: Prices at the gas pump are the lowest since the pandemic and still falling—just in time for record-high holiday travel
item.description: Fuel and crude prices near five-year lows as global oil output led by OPEC and the U.S. continues to rise.

item.title: Quantum computing could be a $198 billion industry in the next 15 years, Jefferies analyst says
item.description: The downside is that the physics and engineering needed to make them work has only just moved out of the theoretical realm and into reality.

item.title: ‘Robots are going to be amongst us’: Qualcomm exec says buckle up for the next 5 years. Your car is going to be the first shoe to drop
item.description: Driver-assisted technology demand is growing for AI features like hands-free highway assist.

item.title: Harvard Secretly Investigates Students Over Larry Summers Video on Epstein
item.description: The students face discipline for recording Mr. Summers, the former Harvard president, discussing his ties to Jeffrey Epstein in a Harvard class.

item.title: Australia, After a Mass Shooting During Hanukkah, Looks for a Path Forward
item.description: The Bondi Beach massacre has people fearing more anti-Jewish violence — and an Islamophobic backlash. But there are reasons to think stability will pr...

item.title: Why more boards are taking a chance on outsider CEOs
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Warner Bros. Says Ellisons ‘Misled’ Shareholders in Takeover Bid
item.description: The claim was made as part of Warner Bros. Discovery’s dismissal of Paramount’s hostile takeover offer.

item.title: One Way the Brown Attack Was Unusual: The Gunman Escaped
item.description: It is rare for a gunman in a high-profile shooting to get away, and many are apprehended within days. The authorities shared grainy video and begged f...

item.title: Free Nigerian Students Recount Mass Kidnapping
item.description: Survivors of the St. Mary’s Catholic School abduction in Nigeria recall their harrowing ordeal and release.

item.title: Trump Revised Chevron’s Venezuela Deal. Maduro’s Oil Trader Profited.
item.description: A firm controlled by a businessman sanctioned by the U.S. Treasury for ties to President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela has sold millions of barrels from...

item.title: The Secret Trial of the General Who Refused to Attack Tiananmen Square
item.description: In 1989, Gen. Xu Qinxian defied orders to crush the pro-democracy protests in Beijing. Now, leaked video from his court-martial is on YouTube.

item.title: First Funeral Held for Victim of Bondi Beach Shooting
item.description: People mourned the death of Rabbi Eli Schlanger during the first funeral for those killed in the Bondi Beach shooting. He was a key organizer of the J...

item.title: UK Rejoins EU’s Erasmus Student Exchange Program That It Left After Brexit
item.description: The government said it would pay about $760 million to allow young Britons to take part in 2027.
